userInterface

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • userInterface.Lab
              • userInterface.Level
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Level
extends Lab
    Virtual Optics

    this class displays a level panel that will contain the level the user currently selected to play on

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void animateDynamicBackground()
      animates the background by rotating components in the activeComponents list according to their position in the list

      import the images needed
      (package private) java.lang.String getTip(int tipNumber)
      imports the tip and return it in the form of a String
      (package private) void infoPanel(int tipNumber)
      An information panel will be displayed in the form of a rounded panel which will indicate the predetermined information to the user according to the current level he is in, indicated by the @param tipNumber.
      (package private) void levelCompleted(int index)
      starts the timer to count the amount of time that the target has been hit
      (package private) void makeGameMenu()
      adds the game menu in the top left corner of this Lab panel
      protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g0)
      paints the background of the level if it has one (only at level 0), set the width and height of the panel according to the size of the frame, paint the ray, paint the markers which indicate the positions of the gameComponents
      void updateProperties(char c)
      Overrides the method from Lab so its functions are neglected
